intro: Diasperus desmogyne, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant has a compact, cushion-like growth form, allowing it to conserve water in harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, reducing water loss through transpiration. Diasperus desmogyne is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient, drought-prone habitats.
